prompt.p: The fundus is the upper portion of the stomach which, together with the corpus or body, acts as a reservoir for food and swallowed air.
Which artery supplies blood to the fundus of the stomach?

modalFeedback.p:
Option E (Short gastric arteries) is Correct. This artery supplies blood to the fundus.
Option A (Left gastric artery) is Incorrect. This artery supplies blood to the cardiac region.
Option B (Right gastric artery) is Incorrect. This artery supplies the lesser curvature of the stomach.
Option C (Splenic artery) is Incorrect. This artery supplieblood to the spleen.
Option D (Gastroduodenal) is Incorrect. This artery supplies blood to the pylorus and duodenum.
